benchmark_details.name: Finetuning Text Classifiers (FTC) metadataset
benchmark_details.overview: The FTC metadataset contains predictions from five large finetuned models across six datasets for text classification tasks, and it evaluates the effectiveness of various ensembling strategies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To analyze the efficacy of ensembling strategies for finetuned text classifiers on various datasets.

data.source: Predictions from five large finetuned models on six datasets: IMDB, Tweet, News, DBpedia, SST-2, SetFit.
data.size: 1,134 evaluated configurations, around 3,800 GPU hours of computation.
data.annotation: Predictions obtained by finetuning models on training data and evaluating on validation and test splits.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated from predictions on validation and test data across different ensembling strategies.
methodology.interpretation: Lower NLL and classification error indicate better model performance.
methodology.validation: Best configurations for each dataset were determined via grid search on validation data.
